passages.1:1: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our dear friend and fellow worker,
passages.1:2: and to Apphia our sister, and to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house.
passages.1:3: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
passages.1:4: I thank my God, always making mention of you in my prayers,
passages.1:5: [because I]<note: *Here "[because]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("hear about") which is understood as causal> hear about your love and faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and for all the saints.
passages.1:6: [I pray] that the fellowship of your faith may become effective in the knowledge [of] every good [thing] that [is] in us for Christ.
passages.1:7: For I have great joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.
passages.1:8: Therefore, [although I]<note: *Here "[although]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("have") which is understood as concessive> have great confidence in Christ to order you [to do what] is proper,
passages.1:9: instead I appeal to [you] because of love, [since I]<note: *Here "[since]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("am") which is understood as causal> am such a one as Paul, now an old man and also a prisoner of Christ Jesus.
passages.1:10: I am appealing to you concerning my child whom I became the father of during my imprisonment, Onesimus.
passages.1:11: Once he [was] useless to you, but now [he is] useful to you<note: Some manuscripts have "both to you"> and to me,
passages.1:12: whom I have sent back to you himself, that is, my heart,
passages.1:13: whom I wanted to keep with me, in order that he might serve me on behalf of you during my imprisonment for the gospel.
passages.1:14: But apart from your consent, I wanted to do nothing, in order that your good [deed] might be not as according to necessity, but according to [your own] free will.
passages.1:15: For perhaps because of this, he was separated [from you] for a time, in order that you might have him back forever,
passages.1:16: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother, especially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.
passages.1:17: If therefore you consider me a partner, receive him as [you would] me.
passages.1:18: But if in anything he has caused you loss or owes [you anything], {charge this to my account}<note: Literally "this to me charge to [my] account">.
passages.1:19: I, Paul, write [this] with my [own] hand: I will pay it back, lest I mention to you that {you owe me even your very self besides}<note: Literally "even yourself to me you owe besides">.
passages.1:20: Yes, brother, I ought to have some benefit of you in the Lord; refresh my heart in Christ.
passages.1:21: Confident of your obedience, I am writing to you [because I]<note: *Here "[because]" is supplied as a component of the participle ("know") which is understood as causal> know that you will do even beyond what I say.
passages.1:22: At the same time also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.
passages.1:23: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,
passages.1:24: [and so do] Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, [and] Luke, my fellow workers.
passages.1:25: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit.
